item.description:
Since there were a few folks who RSVPd with interest for 5:30 AM walks at Maudslay, let's start our early morning walk there.  We'll head up the Hedge Trail and connect to the Laurel Walk (on the main road) for a bit before continuing along the Merrimac River Trail.  Certainly if someone knows how to continue on the Laurel Trail and make the loop back to the Main Road and Hedge Trail, we could do that.  I went for the first time on Saturday and am in love with this park- my new favorite.  The Mtn Laurel was just blooming so hopefully it will be equally gorgeous on Wednesday morning...I'm sure the river in the early morning light is lovely. 

I anticipate this being a fairly fast paced walk- my fruitless attempt at tiring out my dog before I head off to work at 7:30 AM.  So let's try to get 2.5-3 miles in during our one hour walk, leaving RIGHT AT 5:30 AM- and we'll be back at the cars at 6:30.  Primarily packed sand/dirt, with some crushed gravel trails, and a few very short but steep inclines- otherwise very much a  level, very easy trail.  For safety purposes, this walk will only be held if there is enough firm, committed interest...if not, I'll cancel the night before.  Please only RSVP yes if you are truly committed to coming.  I realize not everyone's an early bird- so if you don't typically walk at this hour and are likely to hit snooze or ignore the alarm clock, skip RSVPing for this event and catch us at another one:) But if like me you're an early bird who gets out to walk before work- let's meet up!

I look forward to seeing everyone...and friendly, leashed pooches (that you clean up after) are also welcomed!  Please note there will be a $1 fee collected from everyone to help Angela defray the cost of the meetup dues.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet in the main lot across from the Visitors Center (a white house)...I drive a blue Pacifica with NY plates

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Sunrise Maudslay Walk before we head off to work!
